    publications

    Non-Standard Probabilistic Teleportation through Conventionally Non-Teleporting Channels.

    Published in Preprint (arXiv), 2011

    Download paper here

    Recommended citation: Mishra, M., Mantri, A., Mishra, P., & Panigrahi, P. K. (2011). Non-Standard Probabilistic Teleportation through Conventionally Non-Teleporting Channels. arXiv preprint arXiv:1108.0080. https://arxiv.org/abs/1108.0080

    Optimal blind quantum computation.

    Published in Physical review letters, 2013

    Download paper here

    Recommended citation: Mantri, A., Pérez-Delgado, C. A., & Fitzsimons, J. F. (2013). Optimal blind quantum computation. Physical review letters, 111(23), 230502.. https://journals.aps.org/prl/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevLett.111.230502

    A universal test for gravitational decoherence.

    Published in Nature communications, 2016

    Download paper here

    Recommended citation: Pfister, C., Kaniewski, J., Tomamichel, M., Mantri, A., Schmucker, R., McMahon, N., Milburn, G. & Wehner, S. (2016). A universal test for gravitational decoherence. Nature communications, 7, 13022. https://www.nature.com/articles/ncomms13022

    Universality of quantum computation with cluster states and (X, Y)-plane measurements.

    Published in Scientific reports, 2017

    Download paper here

    Recommended citation: Mantri, A., Demarie, T. F., & Fitzsimons, J. F. (2017). Universality of quantum computation with cluster states and (X, Y)-plane measurements. Scientific reports, 7, 42861. https://www.nature.com/articles/srep42861

    Flow ambiguity: A path towards classically driven blind quantum computation

    Published in Physical Review X, 2017

    Download paper here

    Recommended citation: Mantri, A., Demarie, T. F., Menicucci, N. C., & Fitzsimons, J. F. (2017). Flow ambiguity: A path towards classically driven blind quantum computation. Physical Review X, 7(3), 031004. https://journals.aps.org/prx/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevX.7.031004

    Capacity estimation and verification of quantum channels with arbitrarily correlated errors.

    Published in Nature communications, 2018

    Download paper here

    Recommended citation: Pfister, C., Rol, M. A., Mantri, A., Tomamichel, M., & Wehner, S. (2018). Capacity estimation and verification of quantum channels with arbitrarily correlated errors. Nature communications, 9(1), 27. https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-017-00961-2

    Resource-efficient verification of quantum computing using Serfling’s bound

    Published in npj Quantum Information, 2019

    Download paper here

    Recommended citation: Takeuchi, Y., Mantri, A., Morimae, T., Mizutani, A., & Fitzsimons, J. F. (2019). Resource-efficient verification of quantum computing using Serfling’s bound. npj Quantum Information, 5(1), 27. https://www.nature.com/articles/s41534-019-0142-2

    The Quantum Protocol Zoo

    Published in Unpublished, 2019

    A note on blind contact tracing at scale with applications to the COVID-19 pandemic

    Published in Preprint (arXiv), 2020

    Download paper here

    Recommended citation: Fitzsimons, J.K., Mantri, A., Pisarczyk, R., Rainforth, T. & Zhao, Z. A note on blind contact tracing at scale with applications to the COVID-19 pandemic. arXiv preprint arXiv:2004.05116. https://arxiv.org/abs/2004.05116

    Security Limitations of Classical-Client Delegated Quantum Computing

    Published in Preprint (arXiv), 2020

    Download paper here

    Recommended citation: Badertscher, C., Cojocaru, A., Colisson, L.,Kashefi, E., Leichtle, D., Mantri, A. & Wallden, P. (2020). Security Limitations of Classical-Client Delegated Quantum Computing. arXiv preprint arXiv:2007.01668. https://arxiv.org/abs/2007.01668
